description: Identification and authentication policy and procedures documentation, including roles, responsibilities, review frequency, and approval records
Multi-factor authentication configuration documentation demonstrating phishing-resistant MFA implementation for privileged and non-privileged accounts
List of user accounts with privileged access (super admin, system admin, security officer roles) to all system components
Evidence of NIST SP 800-63B compliance for all authentication mechanisms, including AAL3 requirements for high baseline systems
Password policy documentation showing compliance with NIST SP 800-63B, including minimum length requirements, prohibited password lists, and composition rules
User account provisioning and de-provisioning procedures, including identifier management and reuse prevention controls (minimum 2-year restriction)
Authenticator management procedures covering initial distribution, lost/compromised authenticators, and revocation processes
PIV/CAC credential acceptance and verification configuration for federal agency users
Device identification and authentication mechanisms documentation for local, network, and remote connections
Public key infrastructure (PKI) certificate validation procedures, including certification path construction and revocation checking
Re-authentication policy and configuration showing session timeout limits (12 hours maximum or 15 minutes inactivity for AAL3)
Identity proofing procedures for user account establishment, including evidence collection, validation, and verification methods per NIST SP 800-63A
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for privileged administrative functions
Cryptographic module authentication documentation showing FIPS 140-3 compliance
Non-organizational user identification and authentication procedures, including external authenticator acceptance criteria
Cached authenticator expiration configuration and enforcement evidence
User identifier management records demonstrating unique identification of contractors and foreign nationals (IA-4(4))
Evidence that static authenticators are not embedded in applications or stored unencrypted
